meanings.definition: The act of testing or observing the character or abilities of a person for a period of time to assess their suitability for a particular role or task.
meanings.sent1: During the probation, the new employee's performance will be closely monitored.
meanings.sent2: She was put on probation to see if she could handle the responsibilities of the job.
meanings.sent3: The probation period felt like a trial run for the main event.
meanings.sent4: Her probation was like a magnifying glass on her skills and behavior.
meanings.sent5: The probation served as a crucial evaluation of her capabilities.

meanings.definition: The release of an offender from detention, subject to a period of good behavior under supervision.
meanings.sent1: After serving time, he was granted probation with strict rules to follow.
meanings.sent2: The judge decided to give him probation instead of a longer prison sentence.
meanings.sent3: His probation felt like a second chance to prove himself.
meanings.sent4: Being on probation was like walking a tightrope between freedom and confinement.
meanings.sent5: The probation period was a test of his commitment to staying out of trouble.

meanings.definition: The suspension of a sentence of imprisonment on condition of good behavior.
meanings.sent1: The court granted him probation instead of sending him to jail.
meanings.sent2: She was relieved when the judge decided on probation rather than incarceration.
meanings.sent3: His probation felt like a temporary escape from a harsher punishment.
meanings.sent4: Probation was a lifeline for him, keeping him out of prison.
meanings.sent5: The probation period was a chance for him to prove he could stay out of trouble.
